thread.title: SAS kill squads launch FINAL ASSAULT on ISIS headquarters
thread.title_full: SAS kill squads launch FINAL ASSAULT on ISIS headquarters

title: SAS kill squads launch FINAL ASSAULT on ISIS headquarters
text:
“Mosul would be a tough fight for any army in the world” Lieutenant-General Stephen Townsend 
Troops are believed to have been behind a series of killings of top ISIS leaders in recent weeks in the lead-up to the assault. 
Top jihadi chemical weapon expert and chlorine bomb maker Abu Yaha al-Iraqi was taken out last week. 
ISIS jihadis were also blown up by a "mysterious" bomb blast in one of their camps which killed at least 16 militants. 
GETTY ISIS: Mosul is under siege by the Iraqi Army and their western allies 
GETTY MOSUL: ISIS's last foothold in the west of the city is under threat 
SAS commandos will support Iraqi special forces units and army divisions as they sweep into ISIS-held Mosul. 
Haider al-Abadi, the Iraqi Prime Minister, said: “Our forces are beginning the liberation of the citizens from the terror of ISIS.” 
More than 650,000 people are living beneath the boot of the cult in the western half of the city. 
Lieutenant-General Stephen Townsend, the American head of the western anti-ISIS coalition, said: “Mosul would be a tough fight for any army in the world. 
“The Iraqi forces have risen to the challenge. They have taken the fight to the enemy and sacrificed their blood for the people of Iraq and the rest of the world.” 
Coalition-forces have been slowed in their liberation of Mosul as soldiers have been forced to take back the city street-by-street due to jihadi roadblocks and trenches. On patrol with the Iraqi forces driving ISIS terrorists from Mosul Wednesday, 18th January 2017 The city of Mosul has been an ISIS stronghold since they took control of the city in January 2014. The Iraqi army claim to have taken it back, and defeated the Islamist terrorists. 1 / 12 CTS soldiers fatigued from battle. Related videos
